text: Robe blonde, légèrement trouble, fine mousse. Nez tout en élégance, agrumes, céréales, houblon, légère noté levurée. Bouche tout en fraîcheur et en élégance, bulle fine et fraîche, finale désaltérante sur une fine amertume. Une vraie bière de soif.
Draft at the source. Hazy pale yellow color fluffy white head. Aroma of dusty straw. Taste is white pepper and lemon. Very nice.

On tap at Pin Pon. Cloudy pale yellow with a lasting white head. Malty aroma of fresh grain and bread, with fruity notes and a spicy touch of coriander. Dry, fruity flavour with spices and herbal hops.

Tap at pin pin. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of grape, citrus, bread, malty, very light yeast, light grain, soapy, light wheat notes. Taste is quite bready malts, citrus, light grape. Very well balanced as always with de la senne. Quite pilsner alike but also light wheat. This is an amazing balance.

Tap at Pin Pon, Brussels. Hazy, straw colour. Big, frothy, white head. Cereal. Lemon. Some honeyed sweetness. Taste is crisp and dry. Light bitterness. Fresh and clean. Very nice. Did two in about five minutes!

Draught @ PinPon , Bruxelles. Pours hazy pale yellow with a white head and lacings. Soft citrus and grass. Some straw. Very clean with bright juicy hops shining and minimal malts. Crisp bitter finish.
Tap @ PinPon, Brussels. Hazy yellow body with a medium white head. Grass, citrus, hops. So clean and fresh. Nice grassy and light bitter aftertaste.

keg at the brewery tap
hazy pale gold, clean and lager like, low biterness, fruity, full bodied, moderate carbonation.
Keg at pin pon, says de la Senne on pump clip. Pours hazy pale yellow, nose is light lemon and toffee, taste is dry, citrus, light.
On tap at pinpon, was presented as a Lager or Pilsner, but nothing like that... Very hoppy, clouded pale ale, nice bitterness and dry. Very nice refreshing beer.

Draught: Pint shaker:
Hazy yellow. White head.
Aromas of yeast, soap, citrussy fruits, nice typical De La Senne aroma.
Flavour is bitter, yeast and hop, light fruity, light dry, some herbal and floral tints.
Aftertaste is bitter, malty, some hops, fruits and yeast.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Nice stuff.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: From tap @ PinPon in Brussels. Very nice and refreshing, especially with breakfast since the ABV is not as strong as with most of the Belgian Ales.

Draught at PinPon.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and spices with notes of yeast.
Fruity flavour of hops and grass with notes of spices and yeast.
Hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and light citrusy. Bitter, grassy and crisp hoppy. Dry, citrusy and crisp. Lingering grassy finish.

Hazy yellow, with little to no head. Aroma of oranges, yeast, citrus. Taste is grapefruit, quite bitter, very refreshing, also some orange peels. Every bar in Belgium should have this on tap. Great stuff.

19/X/14 - on tap @ PinPon (Brussels) - BB: n/a (2014-1222) 
Little hazy blond to yellow beer, creamy dense white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: fruity, pineapple, citrus, some grapefruit, bit grassy. Smell is very promising! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very bitter, right from the start, citrus, grassy, grapefruit, bit spicy. Aftetaste: bitter, grassy, dry, citrus, bit of exotic fruits, mainly pineapple.

Bière blonde servie comme une pils: très fraîche dans un verre droit, mais qui nen a que les apparences. En bouche, je goûte un maltage subtil, très porté sur le froment : à la fois astringent et léger mais adouci par un orge malté soyeux. Cest doux sans être vraiment rond. Comme toujours chez De La Senne, cest le houblonnage qui fait la différence. Et je retrouve bien une signature particulière: certainement un houblon noble très aromatique plutôt floral et qui tapisse toutes les papilles et tout le palais avec saveurs minérales, légèrement fruité asseez sèches, avec une levure légèrement argileuse. Seul bémol, cette sensation de farineux en arrière goût. Bière super savoureuse à boire ad libidum.

Draft at Pinpon. Served horrible , but still ... 

Pours hazy blonde , small white head . 
Smell is malty . 
Taste is bitter , malty . Bit organic, reminds a bit of taras bulba . Aftertaste is bitter ( hops ) , rather sharp . Nice ! shame a good beer like this is waisted to a buisness that does not treat it with the respect it deserves ...

2 x 250 ml. draft @ Pin Pon. Great drawings for the beers as expected from De La Senne. Hazy milky golden, small white head. Nose is faint but it was also served way too cold in my opinion, light hop flowers, grass, De La Senne hop-profile but quite light with touch grains. Taste is grainy upfront, substantial body, leading into De La Senne grassy hops, hop flowers, hay, nicely bitter, very bitter zest peel. Grainy body. Taste like a substantial pilsner chockfull of De La Senne hops. All I can say delicious. @ 2  for a glass (more or less standard prize for a pale lager in Belgium), I wish that every bar sold this or a beer similar to this one. This is just a great fix of hops.

Excellent sessioner between Pils and blond ale, with a great look, humbler than usual flowery/pollen yeast profile, without compromising aromatic, multi-layered EU hop bitterness and zest. Pilsner malts lay a near-crisp foundation for some BE ale yeasts to perch on, infusing it with some gentle floral aromatics. Near-watery, i.e. runny without a backbone, this excellent paralympic Pilsners carries a certain "void" in the middle of its taste profile, the sacrifice to BE house ale sessionability (cf. Band of Brothers). Sort of a baby brother to fully matured Taras Boulba. Easy, refreshing and pleasurable new style drinking, especially in its Marolles environment.

Z kranu w browarze De La Senne. 
Piwo jest mętne o kolorze żółtym. Wodniste i mało gazowane. Piwo jest orzeżwiajāce i dobrze chmielone. Nuty cytrusowe i ziarniste. Ogólnie łatwe w piciu o średnio trwałym posmaku.

Draft.
Dorée sur un léger trouble, col blanc épais.
Arôme est houblonné, fruité dans un style très noble rappelant houblons belges et allemands.
Ce dernier est non sans rappeler le houblon frais en sac agrémenté deffluves de malt pils-cara.
Palais est léger sur une base bien pils. Ici on est a mille lieu des pils industrielles. Palais sec, fruité amer venant des houblons, un léger fleuri portant sur des houblons nobles. Le tout conserve une signature typique de DLS surtout au niveau de la base levure et de lamertume. La levure confère une certaine épaisseur de bouche ponctuée de grains. Pour 2 (prix censé augmenter une fois cette période prix cassés passée) on en redemande. Force est encore dadmettre que le dessin de JS Govaerts est parfait.
